posts.title: A man spent 45 days in jail, accused of trying to abduct a child at Walmart. A judge granted a bond after lawyer shows video | CNN
top_comments: Why did it take 45 days for the judge to see the video ?

> “I’m not worried about that. I don’t believe he poses a risk to the community,” said Poole. “The evidence from the video, and I won’t comment on what I think the video really shows, as far as guilt or innocence. It’s not my job today. But the facts do show me that he hung around, and I don’t find that he’s a flight risk based upon what I saw in the video,” Poole said.

So they claim he tried to snatch a child, but then he just stuck around the store continuing his shopping? The footage seems pretty in line with his statement.
So some prosecutor has definitely seen this video of him clearly not doing what he is accused of and continued to hold charges for over a month, and is continuing with the case?

Judges tend to be pretty resistant to examining evidence at bond hearings. I have got them to do it, but it's definitely a matter of pointing at the rule and barging ahead. 

The presumption that the State's version of events is true is extremely strong for most judges. The presumption of innocence is something you get from a jury.
Now the woman crying wolf needs to go to JAIL for lying to police and filing a false police report....and needs to be sued

For those interested in the full video from the court hearing:
https://www.youtube.com/live/brDmaeE5DKo?si=p_GRA25_DRWH402n&t=1009
I don’t understand the woman, like what did she just realize that she had the opportunity to frame a man or has she been looking for this situation? Like it’s such an insane thing to do.

I once read an article explaining the 'do not get involved' culture of China because it was SO common for people to sue people whom tried to help them. People eventually felt the risk was too great and will walk by someone in an emergency. It's stuff like this that worries me we could be headed that way.

Sometimes I worry I'm going to get falsely accused to doing something bad. Something that I would never do/never even consider doing. Even if I tell the truth and say I didn't do it, nobody believes me. And despite me being on camera, it is not conclusive that I didn't do it.

I can't imagine going to a store to buy something, seeing a kid about to fall off a scooter and trying to stop the kid from falling off a scooter, and then being accused of trying to abduct the kid.
Next someone's gonna wonder why people didn't help some kid in distress.

posts.title: Another fighter jet is lost at sea after it falls off USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier
top_comments: Wouldn’t quite equate an arresting gear failure as “falling off”

There's going to be more to this story.  Missing the wires is not rare and not a big deal.  Pilots always go to full power at touchdown whether they catch a wire or not.  Then if they miss they simply climb out and go around.  It's called a bolter.  Since that didn't happen here, something else was going on.
By dumping planes into the ocean it saves the government money because they no longer have to maintain the plane. Government efficiency!
They’ve lost more money dropping planes into the Red Sea than they’ve saved with all the DOGE bullshit.

Snippet from this news article:
“For the second time in eight days, a fighter jet was lost after falling over the side of the USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier and into the Red Sea on Tuesday, two U.S. officials told NBC News.
There were only minor injuries after the two-seater, F-18 Super Hornet fell off the aircraft carrier as it was landing around 9:45 p.m. local time Tuesday (early afternoon East Coast time), the officials said.

The two aviators aboard ejected after the failed landing, in which the aircraft failed to catch the wire, known as a "failed arrestment," one of the officials said.
Two Class-A mishaps in eight days and that captain is gonna lose his job.

I wonder how many they lose in an average year.   

 I'm guessing this carrier is involved with Yemen and the Houthis.

>“The buck stops here.  Fighter jets?  Not so much.”

- The USS Harry Truman.
Who is getting the planes we drop in the water?

Sailor - “Sir, we uh dropped a plane off the side.”

Commander - “It’s ok, just don’t let it happen again.”

Sailor - “Um, sir? Funny story…”

posts.title: Supreme Court upholds Trump's ban on transgender military members while appeals continue.
top_comments: Says the draft dodger

This ruling is far more insidious than it seems too. They didn't ban us on the basis of being "mentally ill" or something. They argued that we are inherently incapable of exhibiting honor, discipline, honesty, selflessness, and humility that is expected of service members.

Arguing that we shouldn't serve because we're mentally ill would still horrendous and incorrect, but they're arguing that we are *morally inferior and unfit* to serve. 

It is *insane* that the SCOTUS rubber stamped this.

Trump reinstated service members who refused to take the COVID-19 vaccine. (The same vaccine Donald Trump, himself, took) Nearly 100 service members died. A half a million were infected. But, lets kick out transgendered troops.
[deleted]
So they’re too weak to be in our military but too strong for sports?
Funny how SCOTUS typically leans on the side of allowing harm when it benefits the prejudices of their base.

Transgender people are the canary in the coal mine. However you may feel, if they are not free to be themselves, then none of us are... Fun fact: All those books the Nazis began with burning was transgender medical research. Up until that time, Berlin was the world leader in healthcare. We know what they ended with burning...
According to their logic it is arrogant and selfish to be trans, thus disqualifying, so I guess 100% of the Trump admin are also unfit to serve in the military.
You can’t have trans people in the military when the military starts rounding up trans people. It’s a conflict of interest you see…
So, the next time that the US will need conscripts, bone spurs will be out and “I identify as….” will be in and they’ll wonder why they can’t feed the war machine.

Who went to jail for these crimes?
I doubt the fine will approach the $4 billion. Why would they stop doing this if they still profit?

>UBS, which acquired Credit Suisse in 2023, said Monday that Credit Suisse Services pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to aid and assist in the preparation of false income tax returns.

Okay so now go after those who filed false income tax returns.
Should send the rich Americans to prison. Oh wait that's for the poor.
Slap on the wrist. Go back to laundering money for the elite and wait for your next slap on the wrist.
I’m starting to think these Swiss bankers are up to no good
There is no Credit Suisse anymore.

posts.title: Three fighter jets crashed in India's Jammu and Kashmir, local govt sources say
top_comments: If there’s anything the war in Ukraine has shown, it’s that most modern armies are not as modern as we think.
Early reports are that Pakistan shot down these jets in Indian airspace from across the border. Curious to see how India responds to what I’m sure they will say is an escalation.
So Pakistan really did shoot down Indian fighters.

The article shows images of one of the three. Below I've linked what I believe are videos of the other two crashed planes - albeit from somewhat biased sources favoring Pakistan. That said, I do believe at least one of them is an Indian Rafael since the markings match. If someone could share more videos that might help identify them, that would be good.

 

## Plane 2

https://nitter.net/AsfandBhittani/status/1919884934614863922

I was able to find it here - though keep in mind its a Pakistani source so the bias in the other direction is there.

## Plane 3

Here's some more wreckage that may or may not be a different plane:

https://nitter.net/clashreport/status/1919917195225636964

 

I want to emphasize though that we can't say for sure whose jets these are, only guess based on wreckage/location.

"four local government sources told Reuters"

Interesting that local government would report this, while Indian government has not.
“Crashed” is certainly one way to describe shot down but I feel it lacks some important context.
Wasn't India using missiles?
Maybe it’s just like how russia would rather claim their own soldiers are incompetent than let the other party claim they got shot down.
Pakistan would have used aerial interception using American F-16s with AIM-120s or Chinese JF-17s with PL-15s/SD-10s.
The only good news is pretty much no major power wants this to escalate all for their own different reasons. Some the same.

posts.title: FBI has opened 250 investigations tied to violent online network '764' that preys on teens, top official says
top_comments: Yeah, this is the type of online grooming I’m highly concerned about, and I’d much rather time and effort be funneled here.

> Reflecting what her family described as a typical 764-related encounter, the girl met him on the popular online gaming platform Roblox, and then they began communicating more regularly online, including on Discord, which caters to gamers.
The man convinced her he was her boyfriend, and she sent him sexual photos of herself -- the types of images that 764 adherents threaten to share widely if victims don't comply with their escalating demands.
According to police, she had produced an assortment of 764-related content, including a photo of a nude Barbie doll marked with "764" on its forehead; photos depicting her cutting herself; and a note, written in her blood, calling her supposed boyfriend "a god."
According to her family, the Connecticut girl was trained to hack into Roblox accounts and lock them -- which allowed her to make demands of account owners if they wanted their accounts back. And she allegedly helped direct a series of threats that rattled Vernon-area schools for three months in late 2023 and early last year.

This is so disturbing. If these kids say no, they get threatened or their family gets swatted. Unmonitored internet usage is far more dangerous than so many parents realize. People will find creative and horrible ways to contact kids online.

I've never understood why they don't investigate more about the people calling in the SWAT raids. I'm really unfamiliar with how the process works, but there seem to be way too many stories of raids on regular people's homes without much seeming to be done about the false SWATters.
surprise! One of the kids on DOGE is affiliated with Com/764. https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/02/teen-on-musks-doge-team-graduated-from-the-com/

“In another federal case, 19-year-old Jack Rocker of Tampa amassed a collection of more than 8,300 videos and images that the Justice Department called "some of the most horrific, evil content available on the Internet." He pleaded guilty in January to possessing child sexual abuse material and was sentenced to seven years in prison.” 
7 years does not seem to be long enough for this type of crime. 8300 videos and images?? And only 7 years?? Make it make sense!!!

It must be a weird environment at the FBI right now. Some branches are going after criminals like normal, some are letting crypto scammers off because Trump's one of them, and others are arresting judges and political opponents. Will your whole investigation be a complete waste of time because the criminal/organization buys a pardon off of Trump? Is the guy at the next desk over part of the secret police? Who knows!
JFC, this is nuts. One more reason to keep my kid off social media and away from shit like Roblox.
If they prey on teens and the FBI considers them domestic terrorists, then a presidential pardon shouldn't be far behind.
It's a good thing the administration is planning to cut the FBI budget.  As they always say, "Won't you please stop thinking about the children!?".
Isn't one of the doge guys part of this group?

posts.title: Trump directs Department of Justice to try to free Tina Peters from prison in social media post
top_comments:
A couple of reminders:

Tina Peters was convicted of Colorado state law felonies by a Colorado jury and sentenced by a Colorado judge and is serving nine years in a Colorado prison.  

She has never professed innocence:  instead, she has asserted falsely that her interference in the elections she was entrusted with administering was justified by large-scale fraud by others.

Today's social-media fart by the President is inflammatory, but not wholly insane.

DOJ is pursuing a Federal habeas corpus writ to get Peters out of prison while she pursues appeals.  That writ keeps getting denied because her state level appeals are not exhausted.

Peters has not applied for state clemency.
She was convicted on state charges. You know. Like the state's right to enforce, properly try and convict a citizen of that state when it runs afoul of a proper law?
Trump himself has 34 felony convictions. One felon trying to jailbreak another felon. And no one seems to have the basic sense to see that this is what is going on!

>“Tina is an innocent Political Prisoner being horribly and unjustly punished in the form of Cruel and Unusual Punishment,” he wrote.

Oh you mean like Kilmar Abrego Garcia, you dementia addled twit?
Trump is such a corrupt sleaze bag. Trying to destroy our rule of law.
They should be happy we applied the rule of law and she had her due process rights and was properly convicted.

Tries to free a felon and lets an innocent man rot in an El Salvadoran torture prison.

The Republican party for you.
He is like:  she backed my lie

He keeps calling his detractors “communists”.  I think we all know who the communists are. 

Sic Semper Tyrannis.
He’s going to facilitate her release, is that what I’m hearing?

Trump wants revenue from tariffs. The middle class can’t foot the entire bill for the bloated military and the rich certainly aren’t going to pay. He’s not looking for deals. Unfortunately, tax on zero is zero. People will live without. Jobs will be lost. Small businesses will fail.

posts.title: Another fighter jet is lost at sea after it falls off USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier
top_comments: Wouldn’t quite equate an arresting gear failure as “falling off”

There's going to be more to this story.  Missing the wires is not rare and not a big deal.  Pilots always go to full power at touchdown whether they catch a wire or not.  Then if they miss they simply climb out and go around.  It's called a bolter.  Since that didn't happen here, something else was going on.
By dumping planes into the ocean it saves the government money because they no longer have to maintain the plane. Government efficiency!
They’ve lost more money dropping planes into the Red Sea than they’ve saved with all the DOGE bullshit.

Snippet from this news article:
“For the second time in eight days, a fighter jet was lost after falling over the side of the USS Harry S. Truman aircraft carrier and into the Red Sea on Tuesday, two U.S. officials told NBC News.
There were only minor injuries after the two-seater, F-18 Super Hornet fell off the aircraft carrier as it was landing around 9:45 p.m. local time Tuesday (early afternoon East Coast time), the officials said.

The two aviators aboard ejected after the failed landing, in which the aircraft failed to catch the wire, known as a "failed arrestment," one of the officials said.
Two Class-A mishaps in eight days and that captain is gonna lose his job.

I wonder how many they lose in an average year.   

 I'm guessing this carrier is involved with Yemen and the Houthis.

>“The buck stops here.  Fighter jets?  Not so much.”

- The USS Harry Truman.
Who is getting the planes we drop in the water?

Sailor - “Sir, we uh dropped a plane off the side.”

Commander - “It’s ok, just don’t let it happen again.”

Sailor - “Um, sir? Funny story…”

posts.title: A man spent 45 days in jail, accused of trying to abduct a child at Walmart. A judge granted a bond after lawyer shows video | CNN
top_comments: Why did it take 45 days for the judge to see the video ?

> “I’m not worried about that. I don’t believe he poses a risk to the community,” said Poole. “The evidence from the video, and I won’t comment on what I think the video really shows, as far as guilt or innocence. It’s not my job today. But the facts do show me that he hung around, and I don’t find that he’s a flight risk based upon what I saw in the video,” Poole said.

So they claim he tried to snatch a child, but then he just stuck around the store continuing his shopping? The footage seems pretty in line with his statement.
So some prosecutor has definitely seen this video of him clearly not doing what he is accused of and continued to hold charges for over a month, and is continuing with the case?

Judges tend to be pretty resistant to examining evidence at bond hearings. I have got them to do it, but it's definitely a matter of pointing at the rule and barging ahead. 

The presumption that the State's version of events is true is extremely strong for most judges. The presumption of innocence is something you get from a jury.
Now the woman crying wolf needs to go to JAIL for lying to police and filing a false police report....and needs to be sued

For those interested in the full video from the court hearing:
https://www.youtube.com/live/brDmaeE5DKo?si=p_GRA25_DRWH402n&t=1009
I don’t understand the woman, like what did she just realize that she had the opportunity to frame a man or has she been looking for this situation? Like it’s such an insane thing to do.

I once read an article explaining the 'do not get involved' culture of China because it was SO common for people to sue people whom tried to help them. People eventually felt the risk was too great and will walk by someone in an emergency. It's stuff like this that worries me we could be headed that way.

Sometimes I worry I'm going to get falsely accused to doing something bad. Something that I would never do/never even consider doing. Even if I tell the truth and say I didn't do it, nobody believes me. And despite me being on camera, it is not conclusive that I didn't do it.

I can't imagine going to a store to buy something, seeing a kid about to fall off a scooter and trying to stop the kid from falling off a scooter, and then being accused of trying to abduct the kid.
Next someone's gonna wonder why people didn't help some kid in distress.

posts.title: Three fighter jets crashed in India's Jammu and Kashmir, local govt sources say
top_comments: If there’s anything the war in Ukraine has shown, it’s that most modern armies are not as modern as we think.
Early reports are that Pakistan shot down these jets in Indian airspace from across the border. Curious to see how India responds to what I’m sure they will say is an escalation.
So Pakistan really did shoot down Indian fighters.

The article shows images of one of the three. Below I've linked what I believe are videos of the other two crashed planes - albeit from somewhat biased sources favoring Pakistan. That said, I do believe at least one of them is an Indian Rafael since the markings match. If someone could share more videos that might help identify them, that would be good.

 

## Plane 2

https://nitter.net/AsfandBhittani/status/1919884934614863922

I was able to find it here - though keep in mind its a Pakistani source so the bias in the other direction is there.

## Plane 3

Here's some more wreckage that may or may not be a different plane:

https://nitter.net/clashreport/status/1919917195225636964

 

I want to emphasize though that we can't say for sure whose jets these are, only guess based on wreckage/location.

"four local government sources told Reuters"

Interesting that local government would report this, while Indian government has not.
“Crashed” is certainly one way to describe shot down but I feel it lacks some important context.
Wasn't India using missiles?
Maybe it’s just like how russia would rather claim their own soldiers are incompetent than let the other party claim they got shot down.
Pakistan would have used aerial interception using American F-16s with AIM-120s or Chinese JF-17s with PL-15s/SD-10s.
The only good news is pretty much no major power wants this to escalate all for their own different reasons. Some the same.

posts.title: Judge orders Trump administration to admit roughly 12,000 refugees
top_comments: A court order you say?  I'm sure the Trump Admin will be concerned by that.
Oh lord he’s gonna bus them to a random location and leave them stranded isn’t he
Hey how about we uphold our promises and obligations without the court having to force us to?

Remember when we put a cap on refugees and turned away a boat load of jews seeking asylum from the nazis?  Then they had to go back and most ended up dying in the holocaust?  If you don't then US education did its job and hid the bad parts from you...
I think I know the next judge that is going to get arrested !
Well we have seen thus far how well Dipshit Donnie follows court orders.

I've been following this story since it broke for personal reasons; I came to the US as a refugee in 1996. 
I so feel for people who were ready to move on with their lives but have been in limbo for months not knowing what will happen to them. My flight was delayed from July to September and I was going mad from worrying. I cannot even imagine sitting in the refugee camp not having the slightest idea what will happen. 
But then again, looking from the inside out, I totally got it. President promised he was gonna do it and refugees are the easiest target. 
In any case this paragraph is quite disheartening:
"The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals largely put Whitehead’s decision on hold in March, finding that the administration was likely to win the case"
I hope justice department, administration and courts figure out something to help those poor people. Soon.

posts.title: A man spent 45 days in jail, accused of trying to abduct a child at Walmart. A judge granted a bond after lawyer shows video | CNN
top_comments: Why did it take 45 days for the judge to see the video ?

> “I’m not worried about that. I don’t believe he poses a risk to the community,” said Poole. “The evidence from the video, and I won’t comment on what I think the video really shows, as far as guilt or innocence. It’s not my job today. But the facts do show me that he hung around, and I don’t find that he’s a flight risk based upon what I saw in the video,” Poole said.

So they claim he tried to snatch a child, but then he just stuck around the store continuing his shopping? The footage seems pretty in line with his statement.
So some prosecutor has definitely seen this video of him clearly not doing what he is accused of and continued to hold charges for over a month, and is continuing with the case?

Judges tend to be pretty resistant to examining evidence at bond hearings. I have got them to do it, but it's definitely a matter of pointing at the rule and barging ahead. 

The presumption that the State's version of events is true is extremely strong for most judges. The presumption of innocence is something you get from a jury.
Now the woman crying wolf needs to go to JAIL for lying to police and filing a false police report....and needs to be sued

For those interested in the full video from the court hearing:
https://www.youtube.com/live/brDmaeE5DKo?si=p_GRA25_DRWH402n&t=1009
I don’t understand the woman, like what did she just realize that she had the opportunity to frame a man or has she been looking for this situation? Like it’s such an insane thing to do.

I once read an article explaining the 'do not get involved' culture of China because it was SO common for people to sue people whom tried to help them. People eventually felt the risk was too great and will walk by someone in an emergency. It's stuff like this that worries me we could be headed that way.

Sometimes I worry I'm going to get falsely accused to doing something bad. Something that I would never do/never even consider doing. Even if I tell the truth and say I didn't do it, nobody believes me. And despite me being on camera, it is not conclusive that I didn't do it.

I can't imagine going to a store to buy something, seeing a kid about to fall off a scooter and trying to stop the kid from falling off a scooter, and then being accused of trying to abduct the kid.
Next someone's gonna wonder why people didn't help some kid in distress.

posts.title: Supreme Court upholds Trump's ban on transgender military members while appeals continue.
top_comments: Says the draft dodger

This ruling is far more insidious than it seems too. They didn't ban us on the basis of being "mentally ill" or something. They argued that we are inherently incapable of exhibiting honor, discipline, honesty, selflessness, and humility that is expected of service members.

Arguing that we shouldn't serve because we're mentally ill would still horrendous and incorrect, but they're arguing that we are *morally inferior and unfit* to serve. 

It is *insane* that the SCOTUS rubber stamped this.

Trump reinstated service members who refused to take the COVID-19 vaccine. (The same vaccine Donald Trump, himself, took) Nearly 100 service members died. A half a million were infected. But, lets kick out transgendered troops.

Fun fact: All those books the Nazis began with burning was transgender medical research. Up until that time, Berlin was the world leader in healthcare. We know what they ended with burning...
